name: Chris Dale
profile: Ambitious Web engineer that enjoys problem solving, writing clean code and has a strong interest in emerging Web technologies. Currently seeking greater responsibility and exciting, new challenges.

responsibilities: Deliver quality code that follows extreme programming principles and has full test coverage
Work effectively as part of an interdisciplinary, Agile team
Review team members work
Mentor junior members of the team
Analyse and make decisions on which technologies are best for a task
Contribute to documentation

company.name: Creative Services
company.description: A digital consultancy providing design and engineering expertise to a client-base of predominantly telecommunications companies and government bodies.

projects.title: Vodafone: Ready Business
projects.description: A promotional tool consisting of survey questions, followed by an interactive results page with tailored feedback, scores and product suggestions. The tool was deployed across 20 of Vodafones' international sites. As the core developer during the project, I had the following resonsibilities:
responsibilities: Build pixel-perfect, cross-browser compatible, responsive UI's
Work closely with designers to solve problems and ensure optimal user experience
Set up and maintain Github repositories and Heroku environments
Provide regular progress reports and technical demonstrations to stakeholders
QA the tool across a range of browsers and devices
Write clear and comprehensive documentation

projects.title: Maritime Engineering App
projects.description: As part of a small development team, I helped build a React App to manage maritime engineering tasks. My responsibilities included:
responsibilities: Build UI components and pages to match visual designs
Build an Express API to mock the client's ICD
Build a lightweight animated splash screen

projects.title: Three Blog Website
projects.description: I was given the task of finishing a partly-built blog site for Three within a tight deadline. My responsibilities included:
responsibilities: Communicate effectively with the client to understand the remaining requirements and priorities
Develop remaining features, including the Load More button, TL;DR switch and an animated GIF pause button
Fix outstanding visual defects

experience.description: As a front-end developer at First Utility my responsibilities included
responsibilities: Build pixel-perfect, cross-browser compatible, responsive UI's
Analyse and make decisions on which technologies are best for a task
Work effectively as part of an interdisciplinary team
Review team members work
Deliver quality, tested code
Carry out overnight deployments using Jenkins

projects.title: Website rebuild
projects.description: Working as part of a team, I helped build a rebranded, responsive version the First Utility website and user account system. The website won the 'Utility Website of the Year' award in 2014 and helped quadruple First Utility's customer base to one million customers.

projects.title: Engery usage graphs
projects.description: Built an interactive graph using Highcharts with data from an API, including caching.

company.name: mydeco
company.description: MyDeco was a small start-up company that provided an online marketplace for homeware and furniture.

company.name: OpenBet
company.description: OpenBet is a leading sportsbook and gaming software company.

company.name: Verve Media
company.description: Verve Media was a small website design and development agency that I interned for between my second and third year at university.

projects.title: Do A Book Website
projects.description: During my internship at Verve Media I worked on a project for Devon County Council that aimed to encourage creative writing amongst children. The Do A Book website allowed children to download a set of illustrations by a local artist, write their own story to the pictures, and then upload their book for others to read and vote on. My responsibilities included
responsibilities: Write the server-side code for the website
Design and build the relational database
Build a simple Content Management System that allowed administrators to login and maintain website content and uploaded books

university.name: University of Southampton
